item.title: NetCDF in R
item.description: NetCDF stands for “Network Common Data Format” and was created by ‘unidata’ for handling large geospatial data. Here’s a short description from their website: “NetCDF is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-orientated scientific data.” NetCDF files are containers for dimensions, variables and global atttributes. It’s used to store climatology, meteorology and oceanography data by over 1,300 organisations including NOAA and EUMETSAT.
